page.title: 02AGRICULTURE AROUND ALRESFORD
page.content: The agricultural land near the town can be described as 'good',with high land values resulting. The climate is one of the best in the U.K. for mixed farming with low rainfall, low frost risk and high sunshine figures giving a long growing season. The soils are mainly developed from Chalk hence are light and dry, if rather flinty. There are patches of heavy clay soil, and in the valley floors there are alluvial soils. The relief is gently rolling. The land cover is dominated by arable crops, barley and wheat, with large fields resulting from the demands of mechanised farming. Most farms, however, have a mixed basis, with dairy herds of Friesian cows. Some Charolais beef cattle are raised. There are intensive pig and poultry units attached to several farms.
